conclusion: Consider refraction of light at the water-air interface with refractive index of water as 4/3.
Calculate the critical angle using Snell's Law with n1 = 4/3 and n2 = 1.
Determine that sin(theta_c) = 3/4 and theta_c = arcsin(3/4).
The radius of the wellhead is 0.5 m and the depth of the well is 8 m.
Form a right triangle with the radius of the wellhead, vertical distance h, and line of sight.
Use tan(theta_c) = 0.5/h in the right triangle.
Calculate tan(arcsin(3/4)) using sin(theta) = 3/4 and cos(theta) = sqrt(7)/4.
Final calculation gives h â‰ˆ 0.44 m.
